summary: Titanium is a strong, lightweight metal with the symbol Ti and atomic number 22. It's resistant to corrosion and found in nature as an oxide, mostly in minerals like rutile and ilmenite. Discovered in 1791, it was named after the Titans of Greek mythology. Titanium is used in many ways: in airplanes and spaceships because it's strong and light, in medicine because it's safe for the body, and in things like jewelry and electronics. It's also very resistant to rusting, even in seawater.
title: Titanium
